At this time, the device executes the manually set temperature and returns to the weekly programming mode in the next time period.

featureDescriptions.This changes the speed that the light di: This changes the speed that the light dims up when controlled from the hub. A setting of 0 turns the light immediately on. Increasing the value slows down the transition speed. Every number represents 100ms. Default = 25 (2.5s)

This changes the speed that the light dims up when controlled at the switch. A setting of 0 turns the light immediately on. Increasing the value slows down the transition speed. Every number represents 100ms. Default = 127 - Keep in sync with dimmingSpeedUpRemote setting.
featureDescriptions.This changes the speed that the light tu: This changes the speed that the light turns on when controlled from the hub. A setting of 0 turns the light immediately on. Increasing the value slows down the transition speed. Every number represents 100ms. Default = 127 - Keep in sync with dimmingSpeedUpRemote setting.

This changes the speed that the light turns on when controlled at the switch. A setting of 0 turns the light immediately on. Increasing the value slows down the transition speed. Every number represents 100ms. Default = 127 - Keep in sync with dimmingSpeedUpRemote setting.
featureDescriptions.This changes the speed that the light di: This changes the speed that the light dims down when controlled from the hub. A setting of 0 turns the light immediately off. Increasing the value slows down the transition speed. Every number represents 100ms. Default = 127 - Keep in sync with dimmingSpeedUpRemote setting.

This changes the speed that the light dims down when controlled at the switch. A setting of 0 turns the light immediately off. Increasing the value slows down the transition speed. Every number represents 100ms. Default = 127 - Keep in sync with dimmingSpeedUpLocal setting.
featureDescriptions.This changes the speed that the light tu: This changes the speed that the light turns off when controlled from the hub. A setting of 'instant' turns the light immediately off. Increasing the value slows down the transition speed. Every number represents 100ms. Default = 127 - Keep in sync with rampRateOffToOnRemote setting.

This changes the speed that the light turns off when controlled at the switch. A setting of 'instant' turns the light immediately off. Increasing the value slows down the transition speed. Every number represents 100ms. Default = 127 - Keep in sync with rampRateOffToOnLocal setting.

featureDescriptions.Automatically turns the switch off after: Automatically turns the switch off after this many seconds. When the switch is turned on a timer is started. When the timer expires, the switch is turned off. 0 = Auto off is disabled.

featureDescriptions.Shows the level that the load is at for: Shows the level that the load is at for x number of seconds after the load is adjusted and then returns to the Default LED state. 0 = Stay Off, 1-10 = seconds, 11 = Stay On.

featureDescriptions.Definition of a new region to be added (: Definition of a new region to be added (or replace existing one). Creating or modifying a region requires you to define which zones of a 7x4 detection grid should be active for that zone. Regions can overlap, meaning that a zone can be defined in more than one region (eg. "zone x = 1 & y = 1" can be added to region 1 & 2). "Zone x = 1 & y = 1" is the nearest zone on the right (from sensor's perspective, along the detection path).

featureDescriptions.Specifies the minimum level that shall b: Specifies the minimum level that shall be applied, when an on/toggle command causes the light to turn on. When this attribute is set to the invalid value (255) this feature is disabled and standard rules apply: The light will either return to the previously active level (before it was turned off) if the OnLevel attribute is set to the invalid value (255/previous); or to the specified value of the OnLevel attribute if this value is in the range 0…254. Otherwise, if the MinimumOnLevel is in the range 0…254, the light will be set to the the previously active level (before it was turned off), or the value specified here, whichever is the larger value. For example, if the previous level was 30 and the MinimumOnLevel was 40 then the light would turn on and move to level 40. Conversely, if the previous level was 50, and the MinimumOnLevel was 40, then the light would turn on and move to level 50.

featureDescriptions.If the heat sink is not fully opened wit: If the heat sink is not fully opened within two weeks or is not used for a long time, the valve will be blocked due to silting up and the heat sink will not be able to be used. To ensure normal use of the heat sink, the controller will automatically open the valve fully every two weeks. It will run for 30 seconds per time with the screen displaying "Ad", then return to its normal working state again.

featureDescriptions.The holiday mode will automatically star: The holiday mode will automatically start at the set time starting point and run the holiday temperature. Can be defined in the following format: `startYear/startMonth/startDay startHours:startMinutes | endYear/endMonth/endDay endHours:endMinutes`. For example: `2022/10/01 16:30 | 2022/10/21 18:10`. After the end of holiday mode, it switches to "auto" mode and uses schedule.
featureDescriptions.`mon_sun` - schedule for Monday used for: `mon_sun` - schedule for Monday used for each day (define it only for Monday). `mon_fri+sat+sun` - schedule for workdays used from Monday (define it only for Monday), Saturday and Sunday are defined separately. `separate` - schedule for each day is defined separately.
Schedule will work with "auto" preset. In this mode, the device executes a preset week programming temperature time and temperature. Before using these properties, check `working_day` property. Each day can contain up to 10 segments. At least 1 segment should be defined. Different count of segments can be defined for each day, e.g., 3 segments for Monday, 5 segments for Thursday, etc. It should be defined in the following format: `hours:minutes/temperature`. Minutes can be only tens, i.e., 00, 10, 20, 30, 40, 50. Segments should be divided by space symbol. Each day should end with the last segment of 24:00. Examples: `04:00/20 08:30/22 10:10/18 18:40/24 22:50/19.5`; `06:00/21.5 17:20/26 24:00/18`. The temperature will be set from the beginning/start of one period and until the next period, e.g., `04:00/20 24:00/22` means that from 00:00 to 04:00 temperature will be 20 degrees and from 04:00 to 00:00 temperature will be 22 degrees.

featureDescriptions.The temperature sensor of the TRV is — d: The temperature sensor of the TRV is — due to its design — relatively close to the heat source (i.e. the hot water in the radiator). Thus there are situations where the `local_temperature` measured by the TRV is not accurate enough: If the radiator is covered behind curtains or furniture, if the room is rather big, or if the radiator itself is big and the flow temperature is high, then the temperature in the room may easily diverge from the `local_temperature` measured by the TRV by 5°C to 8°C. In this case you might choose to use an external room sensor and send the measured value of the external room sensor to the `External_measured_room_sensor` property.The way the TRV operates on the `External_measured_room_sensor` depends on the setting of the `Radiator_covered` property: If `Radiator_covered` is `false` (Auto Offset Mode): You *must* set the `External_measured_room_sensor` property *at least* every 3 hours. After 3 hours the TRV disables this function and resets the value of the `External_measured_room_sensor` property to -8000 (disabled). You *should* set the `External_measured_room_sensor` property *at most* every 30 minutes or every 0.1K change in measured room temperature.If `Radiator_covered` is `true` (Room Sensor Mode): You *must* set the `External_measured_room_sensor` property *at least* every 30 minutes. After 35 minutes the TRV disables this function and resets the value of the `External_measured_room_sensor` property to -8000 (disabled). You *should* set the `External_measured_room_sensor` property *at most* every 5 minutes or every 0.1K change in measured room temperature.
featureDescriptions.Controls whether the TRV should solely r: Controls whether the TRV should solely rely on an external room sensor or operate in offset mode. `false` = Auto Offset Mode (use this e.g. for exposed radiators) or `true` = Room Sensor Mode (use this e.g. for covered radiators). Please note that this flag only controls how the TRV operates on the value of `External_measured_room_sensor`; only setting this flag without setting the `External_measured_room_sensor` has no (noticable?) effect.
featureDescriptions.The mode after a power reset. Default:: The mode after a power reset.  Default: Previous Mode. See instructions for information about manual
featureDescriptions.Hysteresis setting, between 0.5 and 5 in: Hysteresis setting, between 0.5 and 5 in 0.1 °C.  Default: 0.5.
featureDescriptions.Floor temperature over heating threshold: Floor temperature over heating threshold, range is 0-35, unit is 1ºC, 0 means this function is disabled, default value is 27.
featureDescriptions.Maximum temperature limit. Cuts the ther: Maximum temperature limit. Cuts the thermostat out regardless of air temperature if the external floor sensor exceeds this temperature. Only used by the thermostat when in AL sensor mode.
featureDescriptions.Minimum temperature limit for frost prot: Minimum temperature limit for frost protection. Turns the thermostat on regardless of setpoint if the tempreature drops below this.
featureDescriptions.Time of day and setpoint to use when in: Time of day and setpoint to use when in program mode
featureDescriptions.Enables the LED when the light is turned: Включва ЛЕД при изключена светлина, позволявайки видимост на ключа в тъмно
featureDescriptions.Enables the LED when the power socket is: Активира светодиода, при изключен контакт, което позволява да се види на тъмно
featureDescriptions.Switch: allow manual on/off, auto uses c: Switch: allow manual on/off, auto uses contact's C1/C2 wired actions for Peak/Off-Peak electricity rates
featureDescriptions.Off/auto/on (override) (works only if de: Off/auto/on (override) (works only if device is set to "auto" mode)
featureDescriptions.Default level for the dimmer when it is: Default level for the dimmer when it is turned on at the switch. A setting of 255 means that the switch will return to the level that it was on before it was turned off.
Default level for the dimmer when it is turned on from the hub. A setting of 255 means that the switch will return to the level that it was on before it was turned off.
featureDescriptions.The state the switch should return to wh: The state the switch should return to when power is restored after power failure. 0 = off, 1-254 = level, 255 = previous.
featureDescriptions.Percent power level change that will res: Percent power level change that will result in a new power report being sent. 0 = Disabled
featureDescriptions.This will set the button press delay. 0: This will set the button press delay. 0 = no delay (Disables Button Press Events),Default = 500ms.
featureDescriptions.In neutral on/off setups, the default is: In neutral on/off setups, the default is to have a clicking sound to notify you that the relay is open or closed. You may disable this sound by creating a, “simulated” on/off where the switch only will turn onto 100 or off to 0.
featureDescriptions.Double-Tap the Config button to clear no: Double-Tap the Config button to clear notifications.
featureDescriptions.Irrigation target, duration in seconds o: Irrigation target, duration in seconds or capacity in litres (depending on mode)
featureDescriptions.Indicates whether the device detected ra: Indicates whether the device detected rainfall
featureDescriptions.Transmit power, supported from firmware: Мощност излъчване, поддържа се от версия 20221102. Макс за CC11352 e 20dBm и 5dBm за CC2652 (по-високи стойности се конвертират до 5dBm)
featureDescriptions.The device sends commands with this grou: The device sends commands with this group ID. Put devices in this group to control them.
featureDescriptions.Blinks the built-in LED to make it easie: Blinks the built-in LED to make it easier to find the device

featureNames.rampRateOffToOnRemote: Ramp Rate Off To On Remote
featureNames.rampRateOffToOnLocal: Ramp Rate Off To On Local
featureNames.rampRateOnToOffRemote: Ramp Rate On To Off Remote
featureNames.rampRateOnToOffLocal: Ramp Rate On To Off Local
featureNames.periodicPowerAndEnergyReports: Периодични доклади за мощност и енергия
featureNames.doubleTapUpForFullBrightness: Double tap up for full brightness

map.help_coordinator_link_description: Плътните линии са връзка с координатор
map.help_lqi_description: Качеството на връзката е между 0 - 255 (по-високо е по-добре), стойности с / показват много типове връзки
map.help_router_links_description: Прекъснатите линии са връзки с Рутер
map.loading: В зависимост от размера на мрежата може да отнеме от 10 сек. до 2 минути.

donation_text: Здравей, %username%, тук можеш да ни благодариш за работата
Не се страхувай да ни кажеш и нещо хубаво ;)

settingsSchemaDescriptions.Allow new devices to join (re-applied at: Allow new devices to join (re-applied at restart)
You can define external converters to e.g. add support for a DiY device
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Options for active devices (routers/main: Опции за активни устр (рутери/захранване от мрежата)
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Time after which an active device will b: Time after which an active device will be marked as offline in minutes
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Options for passive devices (mostly batt: Опции за пасивни устр (най-често захранване с батерия)
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Time after which an passive device will: Time after which an passive device will be marked as offline in minutes
settingsSchemaDescriptions.MQTT base topic for Zigbee2MQTT MQTT mes: MQTT base topic for Zigbee2MQTT MQTT messages
settingsSchemaDescriptions.MQTT server URL (use mqtts:// for SSL/TL: MQTT server URL (use mqtts:// for SSL/TLS connection)
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Absolute path to SSL/TLS certificate of: Absolute path to SSL/TLS certificate of CA used to sign server and client certificates
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Absolute path to SSL/TLS key for client-: Absolute path to SSL/TLS key for client-authentication
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Absolute path to SSL/TLS certificate for: Absolute path to SSL/TLS certificate for client-authentication
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Include device information to mqtt messa: Include device information to mqtt messages
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Disable retain for all send messages. ON: Disable retain for all send messages. ONLY enable if you MQTT broker doesn't support retained message (e.g. AWS IoT core, Azure IoT Hub, Google Cloud IoT core, IBM Watson IoT Platform). Enabling will break the Home Assistant integration
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Location of the adapter. To autodetect t: Location of the adapter. To autodetect the port, set null
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Disable LED of the adapter if supported: Disable LED of the adapter if supported
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Adapter type, not needed unless you are: Adapter type, not needed unless you are experiencing problems
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Block devices from the network (by ieeeA: Block devices from the network (by ieeeAddr)
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Allow only certain devices to join the n: Разрешете само определени устройства да се присъединят към мрежата (по ieeeAddr). Обърнете внимание, че всички устройства, които не са в списъка с разрешения, ще бъдат премахнати от мрежата!
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Transmit power of adapter, only availabl: Мощност излъчване на адаптер, само за Z-Stack (CC253*/CC2652/CC1352) адаптери, CC2652 = 5dbm, CC1352 максимум = 20dbm (5dbm по подразбиране)
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Examples when 'state' of a device is pub: Examples when 'state' of a device is published json: topic: 'zigbee2mqtt/my_bulb' payload '{"state": "ON"}' attribute: topic 'zigbee2mqtt/my_bulb/state' payload 'ON' attribute_and_json: both json and attribute (see above)
settingsSchemaDescriptions.ZigBee pan ID, changing requires repairi: ZigBee pan ID, при промяна е нужно повторно свързване на устроствата!
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Zigbee extended pan ID, changing require: ZigBee extended pan ID, при промяна е нужно повторно свързване на устроствата!
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Zigbee channel, changing requires repair: ZigBee канал, при промяна е нужно повторно свързване на устроствата! (ВАЖНО: използвайте ZLL канал: 11, 15, 20 или 25 за по-малко проблеми)
settingsSchemaDescriptions.MQTT message payload will contain all at: MQTT message payload will contain all attributes, not only changed ones. Has to be true when integrating via Home Assistant
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Persist cached state, only used when cac: Persist cached state, only used when cache_state: true
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Send cached state on startup, only used: Send cached state on startup, only used when cache_state: true
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Create symlink to current logs in the lo: Create symlink to current logs in the log directory
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Log file name, can also contain timestam: Log file name, can also contain timestamp
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Baud rate speed for serial port, this ca: Скорост на серийния порт, всяка поддържана стойност за фърмуера, обикновенно 115200 за Z-Stack и EZSP, 38400 за Deconz, някои версии на EZSP фърмуер изискват 57600
settingsSchemaDescriptions.RTS / CTS Hardware Flow Control for seri: RTS / CTS Hardware Flow Control for serial port
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Network encryption key, changing require: Network encryption key, changing requires repairing all devices!
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Add a last_seen attribute to MQTT messag: Add a last_seen attribute to MQTT messages, contains date/time of last Zigbee message
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Add an elapsed attribute to MQTT message: Add an elapsed attribute to MQTT messages, contains milliseconds since the previous msg
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Home Assistant legacy entity attributes,: Home Assistant legacy entity attributes, when enabled Zigbee2MQTT will add state attributes to each entity, additional to the separate entities and devices it already creates
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Adapter concurrency (e.g. 2 for CC2531 o: Adapter concurrency (e.g. 2 for CC2531 or 16 for CC26X2R1) (default: null, uses recommended value)
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Use IKEA TRADFRI OTA test server, see OT: Use IKEA TRADFRI OTA test server, see OTA updates documentation
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Home Assistant legacy triggers, when ena: Home Assistant legacy triggers, when enabled Zigbee2mqt will send an empty 'action' or 'click' after one has been send. A 'sensor_action' and 'sensor_click' will be discoverd
settingsSchemaDescriptions.The host running syslogd, defaults to lo: The host running syslogd, defaults to localhost.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.The port on the host that syslog is runn: The port on the host that syslog is running on, defaults to syslogd's default port.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.The network protocol to log over (e.g. t: The network protocol to log over (e.g. tcp4, udp4, tls4, unix, unix-connect, etc).
settingsSchemaDescriptions.The path to the syslog dgram socket (i.e: The path to the syslog dgram socket (i.e. /dev/log or /var/run/syslog for OS X).
settingsSchemaDescriptions.PID of the process that log messages are: PID of the process that log messages are coming from (Default process.pid).
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Host to indicate that log messages are c: Host to indicate that log messages are coming from (Default: localhost).
settingsSchemaDescriptions.The type of the syslog protocol to use (: The type of the syslog protocol to use (Default: BSD, also valid: 5424).
settingsSchemaDescriptions.The name of the application (Default: Zi: The name of the application (Default: Zigbee2MQTT).
settingsSchemaDescriptions.The end of line character to be added to: The end of line character to be added to the end of the message (Default: Message without modifications).
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Your device may request a check for a ne: Вашето устройство може да проверява за актуализация на фърмуера. Тази стойност определя колко често може да се свързва със външни сървъри, за да се търсят актуализации на фърмуера. Стойността се задава в минути, а по подразбиране е 1 ден.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Zigbee devices may request a firmware up: Zigbee devices may request a firmware update, and do so frequently, causing Zigbee2MQTT to reach out to third party servers. If you disable these device initiated checks, you can still initiate a firmware update check manually.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Used in the MQTT topic of a device. By d: Used in the MQTT topic of a device. By default this is the device ID
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Retain MQTT messages of this device: Retain MQTT messages of this device
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Sets the MQTT Message Expiry in seconds,: Sets the MQTT Message Expiry in seconds, Make sure to set mqtt.version to 5
settingsSchemaDescriptions.QoS level for MQTT messages of this devi: QoS level for MQTT messages of this device
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Protects unique payload values of specif: Protects unique payload values of specified payload properties from overriding within debounce time
settingsSchemaDescriptions.The user-defined device icon for the fro: The user-defined device icon for the frontend. It can be a link to an image (not a path to a file) or base64 encoded data URL like: image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB3aW....R0aD
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Location of override OTA index file: Location of override OTA index file
settingsSchemaDescriptions.URL on which the frontend can be reached: URL on which the frontend can be reached, currently only used for the Home Assistant device configuration page
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Output location of the log, leave empty: Output location of the log, leave empty to suppress logging
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Home Assistant legacy triggers, when ena: Home Assistant legacy triggers, when enabled Zigbee2mqt will send an empty 'action' or 'click' after one has been send. A 'sensor_action' and 'sensor_click' will be discovered
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Payload to be used for device availabilt: Payload to be used for device availabilty and bridge/state topics. true = text, false = JSON
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Name of the device in Home Assistant: Name of the device in Home Assistant
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Control when to publish state OFF for a: Control when to publish state OFF for a group. 'all_members_off': only publish state OFF when all group memebers are in state OFF, 'last_member_state': publish state OFF whenever one of its members changes to OFF
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Filter attributes with regex from publis: Filter attributes with regex from published payload.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Filter attributes with regex from being: Filter attributes with regex from being added to the cache, this prevents the attribute from being in the published payload when the value didn't change.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Filter attributes with regex from optimi: Filter attributes with regex from optimistic publish payload when calling /set. (This has no effect if optimistic is set to false).
settingsSchemaDescriptions.SSL Certificate file path for exposing H: SSL Certificate file path for exposing HTTPS. The sibling property 'ssl_key' must be set for HTTPS to be activated.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.SSL key file path for exposing HTTPS. Th: SSL key file path for exposing HTTPS. The sibling property 'ssl_cert' must be set for HTTPS to be activated.
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Disables the device (excludes device fro: Disables the device (excludes device from network scans, availability and group state updates)
settingsSchemaDescriptions.The user-defined device icon for the fro: The user-defined device icon for the frontend. It can be a full URL link to an image (e.g. https://SOME.SITE/MODEL123.jpg) (you cannot use a path to a local file) or base64 encoded data URL (e.g. image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB3aW....R0aD)
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Frontend binding port. Ignored when usin: Frontend binding port. Ignored when using a unix domain socket
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Frontend binding host. Binds to a unix s: Frontend binding host. Binds to a unix socket when an absolute path is given instead

settingsSchemaTitles.Send cached state on startup: Изпрати състоянието на кеша при стартиране
settingsSchemaTitles.IKEA TRADFRI OTA use test url: IKEA TRADFRI OTA използвай тестов адрес
settingsSchemaTitles.OTA index override file name: Презапиши име на файл в OTA индекс
settingsSchemaTitles.Options that are applied to all devices: Настройки които се прилагат за всички устройства
settingsSchemaTitles.IKEA TRADFRI OTA use test url (deprecate: IKEA TRADFRI OTA използвай тестов адрес (старо / не използвай)
